title: Repair & Reconnection
description: Explore how you come back together after disagreements

questions.text: After a disagreement, I trust we'll find our way back to each other.

therapeutic.rationale: Trust in reconnection provides a safety net during conflict. When you know you'll find your way back, disagreements feel less threatening and easier to navigate.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner doesn't trust in reconnection, explore past experiences. Have there been conflicts that didn't resolve? Building repair patterns creates this trust.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared trust in finding your way back provides security during difficult moments.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What helps you trust that you'll reconnect after disagreements?

questions.text: I notice my partner reaching toward me after we've had tension.

therapeutic.rationale: Repair attempts—reaching out after conflict—are one of the strongest predictors of relationship success. Partners who make efforts to reconnect show the relationship matters more than being right.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner doesn't see repair efforts, explore how the other attempts to reconnect. Repair attempts can be subtle and easily missed.
therapeutic.whenSame: Mutual recognition of repair efforts creates a positive cycle of reconnection.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How does your partner try to reconnect after tension between you?

questions.text: I can tell when my partner is trying to make things better between us.

therapeutic.rationale: Recognizing repair attempts matters as much as making them. When partners miss each other's bids to reconnect, conflicts last longer than they need to.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner can't recognize repair attempts, explore what signals the other uses. Learning each other's repair language improves reconnection.
therapeutic.whenSame: Mutual ability to recognize repair attempts shortens the distance after conflict.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What signals does your partner give when they're trying to make things better?

questions.text: We don't let disagreements linger unresolved for too long.

therapeutic.rationale: While some space after conflict is healthy, prolonged distance creates lasting damage. Couples who find their way back in reasonable time maintain their connection.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different perceptions of 'too long' are common. One partner's 'giving space' may feel like abandonment to the other. Discuss what timeline feels right.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared sense of timely resolution creates trust in your repair process.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How long do disagreements typically last between you? Does that feel okay?

questions.text: Coming back together after conflict feels natural for us.

therapeutic.rationale: Natural reconnection suggests you've developed repair patterns that work. When reconnection feels forced or awkward, there may be unprocessed hurt or unclear pathways back.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If reconnection doesn't feel natural, explore what gets in the way. Pride? Lingering hurt? Unclear signals? Identifying barriers helps remove them.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared ease in reconnecting is a relationship strength that supports navigating conflict.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What makes coming back together after conflict easy or difficult?
